item.ptxt: Use the same procedure for the RH and LH sides.
The procedure listed below is for the LH side.

s2.ptxt: Clean the vehicle body surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the vehicle body surface.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Installation temperature.

s3.ptxt: When the ambient temperature is below 15°C (59°F), perform the installation procedure after warming the vehicle body surface (installation surface of the door frame) and tape to between 20 and 30°C (68 and 86°F) using a heat light. When the ambient temperature is higher than 35°C (95°F), cool the vehicle body surface (installation surface of the door frame) and tape to between 20 and 30°C (68 and 86°F) prior to installation.

item.ptxt: The most appropriate temperature for installing the tape is 25°C (77°F).
When the temperature is low, the tape turns stiff and falls off easily. When the temperature is high, the tape loses elasticity.

s2.ptxt: Before installation.

s3.ptxt: Make sure any dirt on and around the vehicle body surface where the tape will be installed (installation surface of the door frame) is removed, and that the surface is smooth. If the surface is rough or dirt remains when pressing the tape onto the surface, air will be trapped under the tape and result in a poor appearance.

atten4.ptxt: Spray water on the shop floor to settle any dust.

s2.ptxt: Key points for handling the tape.

s3.ptxt: The tape bends and rolls up easily. Store the tape between flat pieces of cardboard or other similar objects and keep it dry and level.

atten3.ptxt: Do not bend the tape or leave it in a place with a high temperature.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for a flat surface).

item.ptxt: Position the tape with a high level of accuracy to achieve a neat finish and to avoid peeling.
The tape cannot be reused because it deforms and will not fit after removal.

s3.ptxt: To avoid air bubbles, slightly raise the part of the tape that is going to be applied so that its adhesive surface does not touch the vehicle body while applying the tape. Tilt the squeegee 40 to 50° (for pressing forward) or 30 to 45° (for pulling) from the vehicle body surface and press with a force of 20 to 30 N (2 to 3 kgf) while moving the squeegee at a constant slow speed of 3 to 7 cm (1.2 to 2.8 in.) per second.

atten3.ptxt: Be sure to observe the specified pressing speed, force and angle of the squeegee to avoid wrinkles and air bubbles.

item.ptxt: Either angle of the squeegee (for pressing forward or for pulling) is acceptable.
Be sure to apply the tape while removing the release paper 10 to 20 mm (0.393 to 0.787 in.) from the edge of the squeegee.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for hemming surfaces).

s3.ptxt: If it is difficult to press the tape, press it in several steps as shown in the illustration. Use your fingers or the padded surface of a squeegee to slowly apply the tape to the hem of the vehicle, especially for a small hem.

atten4.ptxt: When applying tape to the backside of a hem, remove the release paper and use your fingers or the padded surface of a squeegee.

s2.ptxt: Key points for the installation of the tape (how to use a squeegee and the installation procedure for corners).

s3.ptxt: Remove the release paper and apply the tape carefully with your fingers.
Before applying the tape to each corner, heat the tape using a heat light and gradually apply it to avoid wrinkles in the tape and achieve a neat finish.

s2.ptxt: Check after installation.

s3.ptxt: After completing the application, check if the tape is applied neatly. If the tape is not applied neatly, apply new tape.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR REAR OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH

atten4.ptxt: When installing the front door rear outer black out tape, heat the front door panel and front door rear outer black out tape using a heat light.

entry.ptxt: Front Door Rear Outer Black Out Tape

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the front door panel or front door rear outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the front door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the front door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the front door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new front door rear outer black out tape.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the front door panel and a new front door rear outer black out tape.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the front door rear outer black out tape.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the front door rear outer black out tape in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the front door rear outer black out tape firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR UPPER OUTER BLACK OUT TAPE LH

atten4.ptxt: When installing the front door upper outer black out tape, heat the front door panel and front door upper outer black out tape using a heat light.

entry.ptxt: Front Door Upper Outer Black Out Tape

atten3.ptxt: Do not heat the front door panel or front door upper outer black out tape excessively.

s2.ptxt: Clean the front door panel surface.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the front door panel surface.
Remove the double-sided tape from the front door panel.
Wipe off any tape adhesive residue with cleaner.

s2.ptxt: Install a new front door upper outer black out tape.

s3.ptxt: Using a heat light, heat the front door panel and a new front door upper outer black out tape.
Remove the peeling paper from the face of the front door upper outer black out tape.

atten4.ptxt: After removing the peeling paper, keep the exposed adhesive free from foreign matter.

s3.ptxt: Install the front door upper outer black out tape in the position shown in the illustration.

atten4.ptxt: Press the front door upper outer black out tape firmly to install it.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR GLASS RUN LH

s2.ptxt: Install the front door glass run.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR BELT MOULDING ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 5 claws to install the front door belt moulding.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR GLASS SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Temporarily install the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.
Connect the cable to the negative (-) battery terminal.
Operate the front door window regulator so that the front door glass can be installed.
Disconnect the cable from the negative (-) battery terminal.

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Remove the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.
Insert the front door glass into the front door panel along the front door glass run as indicated by the arrows in the order shown in the illustration.
Install the front door glass with the 2 bolts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR SERVICE HOLE COVER LH

s2.ptxt: Apply new butyl tape to the front door panel.
Pass the wire harness through a new front door service hole cover.

Pass the front door inside locking cable and front door lock remote control cable through a new front door service hole cover, and then install the front door service hole cover using the reference points on the front door panel.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR NO. 1 TRIM BRACKET

s2.ptxt: Install the front door No. 1 trim bracket with the 2 screws.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR INSIDE HANDLE SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Connect the front door inside locking cable and front door lock remote control cable to the front door inside handle.
Attach the 2 guides as indicated by the arrow in the illustration, and then attach the claw to install the front door inside handle.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL OUTER REAR VIEW MIRROR ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: w/ Front No. 2 Speaker:

s3.ptxt: Install the mirror so that the claw attaches, and install the 2 nuts.
Connect the connector.

s2.ptxt: w/o Front No. 2 Speaker:

s3.ptxt: Install the mirror so that the claw attaches, and install the 3 nuts.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT NO. 2 SPEAKER ASSEMBLY (w/ Front No. 2 Speaker)

s2.ptxt: Install the front No. 2 speaker assembly with the nut.
Connect the connector.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR TRIM BOARD SUB-ASSEMBLY LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 9 clips to install the front door trim board.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL FRONT DOOR LOWER FRAME BRACKET GARNISH LH

s2.ptxt: Attach the 3 clips to install the front door lower frame bracket garnish.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL POWER WINDOW REGULATOR MASTER SWITCH ASSEMBLY WITH FRONT DOOR ARMREST BASE PANEL

s2.ptxt: Connect the connector.
Attach the 8 claws and 2 clips to install the power window regulator master switch assembly with front door armrest base panel.
Install the screw.

s-1.ptxt: CONNECT CABLE TO NEGATIVE BATTERY TERMINAL

atten3.ptxt: When disconnecting the cable, some systems need to be initialized after the cable is reconnected (See page ).
